title: How to Write a Letter to Grandma

steps.title: Start off with an opener:
steps.content: Start off with an opener: 'Dear beloved Grandmother,....' etc. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Indent the paragraph, then write a beginning for the letter:
steps.content: Indent the paragraph, then write a beginning for the letter: [2] X Research source Thanks for (action) or you could start off with: 'Remember when, (time)' You want her to feel special. You want her to remember the letter. Especially if you are reading this because you probably haven't even written her a letter before!

steps.title: Fill the body of the letter with the facts, opinions, and special moments of her.
steps.content: Fill the body of the letter with the facts, opinions, and special moments of her. [3] X Research source This is where you fill it with the words that brought you to write her a letter. [4] X Research source The body is most likely the largest part of the letter. Fill it up!

steps.title: Write your closing paragraphs.
steps.content: Write your closing paragraphs. Write something like in conclusion, or lastly. This hints her that your letter is coming to a close. Bring back the reason why you wrote the letter. If you wrote her the letter because you wanted to thank her for something, your closing should look something like this: I thank you for the (object) because it is one of the best things I have ever received. You are the kindest woman in my life. See you soon! Love, (name). [5] X Research source

steps.title: Start with dear beloved granny/grandmother.
steps.content: Start with dear beloved granny/grandmother. Share her your memories of when she visited last time and say you miss her and that you're looking forward to seeing her again soon.

steps.title: Write about your favorite dishes that she prepares if you like food.
steps.content: Write about your favorite dishes that she prepares if you like food. Or, perhaps there is some other thing she does that you'd like to praise.

steps.title: Take care with your writing.
steps.content: Take care with your writing. There are some things to bear in mind when writing the letter, such as: [6] X Research source Don't be too sentimental while writing; this spoils the natural effect of your message. Don't give bad expressions about anyone whom she loves. Avoid using slang or curse words.

steps.title: End on a positive note.
steps.content: End on a positive note. Include a promise from you to do something unexpected for her (something she likes).
